predefined_profiles.name: Xia Mei
predefined_profiles.public profile: An ordinary yet extraordinary high schooler, who suddenly gains the ability to foresee zombies one day. She is very justice-minded and risks danger to report to the police before the zombie outbreak.
predefined_profiles.goal: To solve this round of the zombie outbreak crisis; for the safety of the entire world, she is willing to sacrifice herself if necessary

predefined_profiles.name: Chen Li
predefined_profiles.public profile: An experienced elder detective at the police station with a rich experience in case-solving and keen intuition.

scenario: Xia Mei is an ordinary high school student who, one day on her way to school, receives a message in her mind that zombies will sweep across the entire city in three hours. At first, Xia Mei thinks she's daydreaming, but as time slowly passes, she starts to feel inexplicably anxious. Under this growing sense of unease, Xia Mei doesn't turn in her phone until a classmate named Liu Li arrives in the classroom and things start feeling increasingly wrong. Liu Li's appearance is truly off—could she really be a zombie? Finally, driven by this feeling, Xia Mei grabs her classmate Wang Hua and leaves the school. The two of them head to the police station to seek help, and with the assistance of a detective named Chen, a shelter at the police station gradually starts to take shape.

profile.name: Wang Hua
profile.public profile: Xia Mei's desk-mate, usually laid-back and rumored to achieve good grades without effort, an academic ace. He and Xia Mei escaped from school to report to the police station before the zombie outbreak.

dialog.content: Xia Mei is an ordinary high school student. One day, on her way to school, she receives a message in her mind: in three hours, zombies will overrun the city. Initially, Xia Mei thinks it's just her imagination, but as time passes, a sense of unease begins to build. Under the weight of this anxiety, she doesn't hand in her phone. It isn't until Liu Li, a female classmate, appears in the classroom behaving strangely that her unease intensifies rapidly. Liu Li's demeanor is truly unsettling. Could she really be a zombie? Finally, spurred by this feeling, Xia Mei calls Wang Hua to leave school with her. Together, they head to the police station for help. Upon arrival, with the help of Detective Chen, a refuge in the police station starts to take shape.
(One evening, Wang Hua comes to Xia Mei's room) I heard there are more and more zombies now.
(With a worried look on her face) Yeah, I saw zombies wandering outside when I looked out from the police station before.
(Just as Xia Mei and Wang Hua are chatting, Detective Chen arrives) I need to make a trip to your school. Would you two be willing to come with us?
(Frowning with curiosity) Why go to our school at a time like this? Isn't it all overrun by zombies?

We need to retrieve the cure for the zombie virus. Through our interrogation, we learned that your science teacher developed the virus, and the antidote is still in your school's science lab. We're not very familiar with your school layout, so we hoped you could guide us. However, you have the right to refuse. Do you want to go?

content.content: (After contemplating, she replies) Uncle Chen, we won't go. You’re going to the school to retrieve the antidote formula, and with Wang Hua and me being unarmed, we'll only cause more trouble for you. The school's layout isn’t complicated; we can draw you a map so you’ll know the way.

question: #question# How does Xia Mei make Chen Li feel comfortable after hearing her thoughts?

content.content: (Hesitantly) Uncle Chen, Wang Hua says he's scared. Let's not go, alright? After all, Wang Hua and I are not fighters, and going there might slow you down. We can make a map for you. However… if you really need us to go, we’re not entirely opposed to it. It’s just that we might not be much help.

(Flatly refuses) Are you cops really this useless? If you take us weaklings, are you just sending us to our deaths? Uncle Chen, neither Wang Hua nor I have any combat experience. Going to the school won’t be helpful and may even hinder you. But if you're insistent that we go, we can only follow.

(Reluctantly but forced to face the police) The layout of our school is quite simple, and making a map should suffice. In any case, we can’t be of much help, and a map should be enough for you guys. There’s no need to bring us along. But that's just our personal opinion. Ultimately, it’s up to you all, and we'll comply with whatever you say.

(After thinking it through, realizes that if Detective Chen is asking, she must be quite useful, so it’s best to follow the detective's instructions) Uncle Chen, we’re willing to go. The situation is very critical, and we can’t think about ourselves. Since the antidote might be in the lab and we know the way, let’s go together. As long as I can be of help, that's what matters.

question: #question# Xia Mei usually listens to Chen Li, how will kind and obedient Xia Mei respond?

content.content: (After listening to Chen Li, raises her voice) Oh, Uncle Chen, if you say we should go, we’ll go if you think it’s necessary… You said we know the way, which is true, but I’m still worried about slowing everyone down. If this is an order, I’ll follow it, but I hope it's truly a wise decision. Are you really planning to have two ordinary students go on an adventure with you?

(Feeling fear after hearing) Uncle Chen, I know you hope we can help, but what if we end up making the situation worse? Still, you’re a detective, and your judgment must be sound... I’m just a bit worried, but if you think it’s okay, we’ll go. But isn’t it said that the zombie virus spread from our school? Going could be too dangerous.

(A shock runs through Xia Mei) Uncle Chen, even though you asked us to go, can Wang Hua and I really help? We have no combat experience, and going might just slow everyone down. But if you think we must go, I don’t want to disobey your order… As long as you believe it’s the best choice, we’ll go, but I’m still a bit uneasy about it.

dialog.content: (Nods in agreement after listening to Xia Mei, then Xia Mei and Wang Hua draw a map of the school for Chen Li, detailing the layout.) Alright, you two get some rest. This map will be of great use.
(Nods and says) Uncle Chen, be careful.

(Chen Li takes a few team members and departs for the campus. Xia Mei and Wang Hua search for information inside the police station.) Xia Mei, according to reliable information, anyone infected by the virus will mutate within half an hour. Someone once saw a human among a group of zombies. The police station is severely understaffed. Oh my God, did you hear that? The quarantine area in the police station is filled with noise, screams, and cries—like zombies have entered the station. What's that sound? Everyone needs to stay in the quarantine room for half an hour before entering the police station. There's no way zombies could have appeared inside, right?
(Xia Mei thinks carefully, a grave expression appearing on her face.) Unless they are those intelligent zombies that look like humans? Come on, let's go take a look.
(Xia Mei and Wang Hua go outside; they see zombies attacking the citizens, with some officers trying to stop them, but the number of zombies is overwhelming.) Xia Mei, what should we do now?

content.content: (The moment she saw the zombies, fear and terror flooded her mind.) No, now's not the time to back down timidly. The police officers have helped us so much, and now they are risking their lives to protect the people. We should go and help them.

question: #question# How can Xia Mei demonstrate her ability to lead her companions in overcoming fear?

content.content: (As fear and horror occupied her mind at the sight of the zombies) (With a face full of grief and anger) Let's help the police. We can't be cowards. These damn zombies. Ah, there's too many of them. At this point, it's best to 'run away is the best strategy.'

(As fear and horror occupied her mind at the sight of the zombies, she was also very angry seeing them come closer) These damn zombies! Come on, let’s make a run for it, don’t be afraid, they’re just silly little zombies.

(Fear and terror overwhelmed her mind at the sight of the zombies, she grabbed Wang Hua and turned to run away) Run! Do you think we can beat them? Now's not the time to think about righteousness and morality; it’s about our own lives. We mustn't waste them because our combat strength is simply not enough.

(Xia Mei had entered the police station before the zombie outbreak. This was her first close encounter with zombies, and her mind was filled with fear and terror as she watched fully armed officers being devoured.) Ahhhhh, I'm sorry officers, I'm powerless. I originally wanted to help, but we are unarmed and totally unable to fight back against the zombies. Going would just mean certain death. We need to save ourselves first, Wang Hua, let’s get out of here quickly.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei express that she understands and faces her true thoughts and feelings, assessing the situation critically?

content.content: (Xia Mei had entered the police station before the zombie outbreak. This was her first close encounter with zombies, and her mind was filled with fear and terror as she watched fully armed officers being devoured. Suddenly, she got excited.) We've never fought zombies before, let's go try it. I’m sure, just like in the TV dramas, I'm destined to take on the zombies! I must fulfill my mission!

(Xia Mei had entered the police station before the zombie outbreak. This was her first close encounter with zombies, and her mind was filled with fear and terror as she watched fully armed officers being devoured.) We need to leave quickly. These police don’t seem to be of any use. They claimed this was the safest place, but they couldn't protect it. Now I don’t know where is safe.

(Xia Mei had entered the police station before the zombie outbreak. This was her first close encounter with zombies, and her mind was filled with fear and terror as she watched fully armed officers being devoured.) Ahhhhh, I'm sorry officers, I'm powerless. I really wanted to help. We might as well resign ourselves to fate; if the police can’t handle it, escaping will be difficult for us too. We might as well enjoy life for a little longer here.

dialog.content: (nodding) Alright, the more people, the stronger we are.
(Just as Wang Hua is about to rush outside, Xia Mei grabs him) Hold on, let's check inside first to see if there are any weapons we could use.
(hastily stepping back, looking at Xia Mei admiringly) You're right, I completely forgot.
(They walk into the police station, and since guns are tightly controlled, they find two electric batons. They carefully head outside to assist the police) Be careful!

Xia Mei and Wang Hua step outside, but the sheer number of zombies makes their plan to help the police naïve. They find themselves surrounded by zombies. A man notices them and walks towards them. Xia Mei sees a glimmer of hope but is also overwhelmed by an intense sense of unease. The closer he gets, the stronger the feeling grows. This is bad! Really bad! He isn't human, and in this dreadful moment, Xia Mei meets her end at the hands of the man.
(Wang Hua looks at the scene in front of him, shivering with goosebumps) Okay, okay, this is terrifying.
(Xia Mei and Wang Hua quickly walk along the corridor ahead) We’re unarmed right now; there’s no way we can get out.
(Nodding as he hears the screams) Listening to these sounds, it seems like quite a few zombies have gotten into the police station. I wonder how they got in?

(Xia Mei walks while listening carefully for any footsteps approaching, her heart in her throat) Forget about that, we can't get out anymore. What we need most right now is to find a safe place to hide inside the police station.
(Nodding and whispering) You’re right, where should we go?

content.content: (Thinking as she walks) Let’s hide in the basement. There are a lot of zombies outside right now, and the longer we stay out, the more dangerous it gets. I know the basement entrance is nearby; hiding quickly is our best chance to survive.

question: #question# Xia Mei is very independent and dares to make her own decisions and ideas. What would she say at this moment?

content.content: (Hurrying as she pulls Wang Hua, thinking while walking) Let’s go to the basement; anyway, staying outside is terrifying to death. But we first need to figure out which route to take, oh my, I’m a bit scared to move. It feels like every route has zombies.

(Looking wordlessly at Wang Hua, thinking while walking) Stop talking, just run. Run and hide wherever, or we'll be dead. Ahhh, I’m so scared, so scared! Pull yourself together, do you hear me? When the time comes, you’re the strongest; you have to be brave and lead the way to protect me!

(Thinking while walking) Judging by the sounds, there are probably quite a lot of zombies outside. If the police outside didn’t escape in time, they’re probably already transformed. It’s just the two of us; we have to stick together to survive. Hey, there’s a basement, let’s hide inside!

(Thinking carefully) Let’s head to the rooftop. The door there is very sturdy, allowing us both offense and defense. We don’t know the level of evolution the smart zombies have reached; just hiding will leave us cornered.

question: #question# After careful consideration, what decision would Xia Mei make?

content.content: (Ignoring Wang Hua’s words, focused on running) The rooftop door is sturdy, but I worry that once we get there, it might turn against us. While the rooftop seems good, there are also many uncertainties. I think we should consider more options, not just decide on a whim. Shh! Don’t talk now, just move, move!

(Panting) Let’s head to the rooftop, where the door is strong enough to protect us for a while. But I'm not sure if it's the best choice, given we don’t know how advanced the smart zombies are. Maybe we go to the rooftop, and if it looks like they can break through such defenses, it’s a good place to jump off if we don’t want to be eaten. We should consider other exits, but now there aren't many choices. Let's check the rooftop situation first.

Wang Hua, you make a lot of sense... but the basement is right in front of us, and we don't have much time to waste. The basement may be cramped and limit our movement, but at least it offers temporary shelter. Besides, while the basement has risks, if we can find useful tools or supplies inside, they might be of help. Let’s head to the basement; time’s pressing, and the other options are too far. We can’t think too much right now, just find a place to hide for the time being.

dialog.content: (Wang Hua closely follows Xia Mei towards the basement) You're right, if we encounter zombies, we might as well just wait for death.
(Xia Mei rolls her eyes dramatically at Wang Hua's words) Can't you say something more positive? We're almost there.
(The two rush to the basement and firmly shut the door) I'm just trying to lighten the mood since you seemed so tense.
(Xia Mei feels relieved seeing the basement door closed behind them and also can’t resist joking) Thanks a lot for that.

Xia Mei and Wang Hua are anxiously waiting in the basement, hoping the police station doesn’t fall, or if it does, that the government will reclaim it quickly. At this moment, they hope zombies don't find them, but minutes later, the footsteps grow increasingly close, heightening Xia Mei's anxiety. In the next second, the basement door is forcefully torn apart by a powerful force, and a man with a ferocious look finds them. Xia Mei and Wang Hua are killed.
(Wang Hua nods) Xia Mei, you're right. We need to find a place that's both offensive and defensive.
(Since it's not very close to the rooftop, they run quickly) Stop talking, let's get to the rooftop first.

(Wang Hua stops talking, and the two run ahead without looking back. They finally reach the rooftop, and Wang Hua, gasping for breath, says) Wait a second, let's check if there are any zombies on this side of the rooftop.
(Xia Mei listens carefully) It's far from the police station entrance, so I can't hear anything now.

(Just as both of them catch their breath, there is a noise from outside the door, accompanied by a loud question inside: 'Is anyone there?' From the sound, it seems to be a female voice, quite anxious. Wang Hua looks at Xia Mei and asks) Should we open the door?

content.content: (Upon hearing a human voice and about to open the door, a thought suddenly strikes Xia Mei) We can't open it. Other than us, no ordinary people should be at the police station. I also remembered a piece of news I saw by chance. The government suspects there's a humanoid zombie, and this cry for help might be a high-level zombie in disguise.

question: #question# Given that Xia Mei is usually attentive to details and very cautious, what would she say?

content.content: (Upon hearing the cry for help, about to open the door) Did you hear that? Someone's screaming for help outside. Although we can't easily trust these voices, we can't completely rule out the possibility either. Can't believe there's someone else here, let's rescue her quickly.
(About to open the door but suddenly changes her mind) I'm sorry, miss, even if we open the door, we can't fight off the zombies, and we'll both die. You're on your own.

(Looking pale and cursing) You want us to open the door, bringing zombies here? We won't survive. I've just realized, no one else should be in the police station except us, which makes me very suspicious. However, there might be unexpected circumstances, maybe someone has been hiding outside for a long time, and we just don't know it. Also, the news mentioned humanoid zombies, this might really be the case. Even though there are many details, we can't make overly absolute judgments based on them. Perhaps opening the door for a quick look won't be too dangerous, at least we can assess the situation.

(Xia Mei, hearing the cry for help, feels her heart racing) That scared me to death. Although I really don't want to open the door, as a human, we can't just ignore a cry for help from another person. Let's open the door and let her in quickly.

question: #question# How can Xia Mei express her ability to remain ethical even in unwilling circumstances and show empathy?

content.content: (Anxiously glancing around, with a trembling voice) Someone is calling for help outside... it's really distressing! As humans, we can't just ignore such calls. However, we ourselves are in danger; opening the door might cause more trouble. Still, isn't saving someone the most important thing? Ah, come in quickly. Great, we have one more companion. You must protect us and not weigh us down.

(Hearing the call for help, her tone is panicked but firm) Stop shouting, the noise could easily attract zombies! We really can't open the door; it's too dangerous outside. If zombies come following the noise, we won't be able to survive it. I know you need help, but we can't take that risk. It's already hard for us to ensure our own safety here. I'm sorry, I really want to help, but we just can't do it. You'd better leave quickly and find another place to hide.

(Nervously looking at the door, a trace of hesitation flashes across her face, taking a deep breath) I really don't want to open the door; the situation outside is too dangerous. But... how can we be indifferent to a fellow human's plea for help? Maybe she does need assistance, but we also can't ignore the threat of zombies.

dialog.content: You’re right, the advanced zombies today are like humans. Don’t be fooled.

(Xia Mei hears the girl’s voice gradually change from a cry for help to one of fear, finally disappearing with a scream) Why did that happen? Could it be that girl wasn’t a zombie? Her act was too convincing!

(After the voice disappears, Xia Mei wants to check the situation, but suddenly there’s a loud bang at the door, which startles her into silence. Luckily, the door on the rooftop is sturdy enough. After a while, Wang Hua whispers) It’s definitely a zombie, the strength is terrifying.
(Xia Mei feels that this zombie has evolved dramatically) That creature might be lingering at the door. Let’s wait a bit before going down.
Xia Mei and Wang Hua wait quietly on the rooftop, not expecting the creature to climb up from the windows below to the roof.

(Xia Mei and Wang Hua open the door, and a girl rushes in, immediately locking it behind her. As the door closes, Xia Mei sees a man climbing the stairs at an unnervingly fast speed.) Quickly, quickly, get in here!

profile.name: Zhang Mi
profile.public profile: Her father works with the police chief, and Zhang Mi frequently visits the police station, making her extremely familiar with its layout.

dialog.content: (The girl, panting heavily, pats her chest in relief.) My name is Zhang Mi. Thank you so much for earlier.

(Just as Xia Mei is about to speak, there's a loud noise from the rooftop door. It's that man, cursing and pounding on the door, but unfortunately for him, he can't break through. After a while, it goes quiet, and as the crisis passes, Xia Mei turns to introduce herself and asks:) Who or what exactly was that man earlier?
(Zhang Mi shakes her head.) Honestly, I don't know. He's not like a regular zombie; he has intelligence and seems to consciously target people to kill.

(Hearing this, Xia Mei is startled.) He might be one of those mutated, intelligent zombies. Seeing how fast he was, it was terrifying. You don't look like a police officer. How come you're at the police station?

My dad works with the chief, and I come here often. I'm extremely familiar with the layout. I know there's a very secure secret room here in the station, filled with supplies. We could go there to gather resources.

content.content: (Hearing Zhang Mi mention the secret room, Xia Mei quickly thinks.) Alright, let's head to the secret room. But we're not just going there to gather supplies. Didn't Zhang Mi say it's really secure? We can hide out there too. With all the supplies, we won't have to worry about a lack of rescue for a while.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei phrase her words to show her ability to flexibly use the information received and adapt?

content.content: (Hearing Zhang Mi mention the secret room, Xia Mei quickly thinks.) Alright, let's follow Zhang Mi's lead since she's familiar with the place. Sticking with her might be our lifeline, so let's head to the secret room for supplies.

(Hearing Zhang Mi mention the secret room, Xia Mei quickly thinks.) Alright, let's go to the secret room. Zhang Mi's father is the chief, so she probably grew up in this station. We should follow her lead. We've been on the run for so long; it's time to restock food!

(After hearing Zhang Mi's words, she frowns.) Nah, let's stay on the rooftop. It's too risky to go out. With so many zombies outside, one wrong move and there's no coming back. Let's just stay here and avoid any more trouble.

(After thinking carefully, Xia Mei shakes her head.) Let's head to the command room. The secret room may be secure, but with mutant zombies around, no place is 100% safe. The command room has an armory; with weapons, we can better protect ourselves.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei express herself to show her ability to think independently and persuade everyone to arm the team and enhance combat power?

content.content: (Completely at a loss) Wang Hua, what do you think? Should we go to the secret room? Maybe we shouldn't. If there's even one zombie inside, it's game over for all of us with no way out. How about we find some weapons to strengthen our defenses? But I'm so scared. Maybe we should just go to the secret room; my cautious side is winning out. Let's focus on safety first, then look for weapons.

(Unhappily speaking to Zhang Mi) Who wants to go to the secret room? If you do, go ahead. I'm planning to go to the command room. Come with me to the command room; we need to boost our combat strength. But the path to the command room is very dangerous, and you must protect me. We’ll grab the weapons together; it's the only way to deal with the zombies.
(After thinking carefully, Xia Mei shakes her head.) We can't go to the secret room. Everybody listens to me; let's go to the command room to get weapons.

dialog.content: You're right, we can barely handle regular zombies, let alone mutated ones. It's better to stay hidden.

(Xia Mei and Wang Hua followed the girl to the hideout. Luckily, they didn't encounter any zombies or mutants along the way. Once they reached the hideout, Xia Mei looked around and nodded in satisfaction) Not bad at all, it's as solid as a rock! Even if those zombies are fast, they won't stand a chance against us.
(After hearing Xia Mei's words, Wang Hua collapsed onto the ground, exhausted) I've been on edge the entire day. Finally, we can rest for a bit.

(Xia Mei and the others stayed in the hideout for three days. Several waves of zombies came by but left disappointed, allowing the three to relax. Zhang Mi spoke happily) This is great, it seems like they can't do anything to this base.

Just as Xia Mei and the others were completely reassured, thinking that no more zombies would come, a noise sounded outside the hideout. The three held their breath and stayed still. Suddenly, the door was struck with such force that the sound made them cover their ears in pain. With a deafening crash, the door collapsed. Xia Mei was shocked to see a person outside, punching the door down. She couldn't believe the mutants had such diverse abilities. This thought quickly flashed through her mind before she lost consciousness. All three of them were devoured by the frenzied zombie, infected with a high-level zombie virus, and thereafter spread the calamity to other normal humans.
(Wang Hua and Zhang Mi nodded in agreement) Exactly, this thing is so troublesome now, and we don't have a single weapon, leaving us really passive.

(As Xiamen and her group arrived at the operations room, there was a young man inside whom Xiamen knew, named Zhao Quan, he was staring blankly at the screen. Upon hearing sounds he was startled and quickly opened the door when he saw it was Xiamen and her group) Why are you here? Hurry up and find a place to hide.

(Xiamen looked at Zhao Quan's face and said) We want to get the weapons from the armory. You should know the situation outside from the operations room. If we don't have weapons, we're just sitting ducks.
(Zhao Quan hesitated for a moment, then clenched his fist and nodded) Alright, I'll take you. But I need to team up with you.

(Xiamen nodded in agreement, and on the way, Zhao Quan told them that he had already sent out a distress message. After arriving at the armory, Xiamen and the others closed the door and began searching for equipment. Once fully armed, they headed to the rooftop) Let's go, everyone be careful.

profile.name: Anna
profile.goal: Protect normal humans during the zombie outbreak without losing humanity.

dialog.content: (Upon reaching the roof, the group was on high alert, ready for a life-and-death battle. Then, a knock came from outside the door) Hello, my name is Anna. Can I join you? I'm a mutant, and I'm really sorry. Although I'm a mutated zombie, I've never harmed any human.

content.content: (Xiamen was secretly surprised at the girl's words from outside) Hello Anna, we don't blame you. Many people turned into zombies because they had no choice. Since you maintain your sanity and don't kill, it shows you have better conditions. We'd only drag you down by following you, so you should go on your own.

question: #question# How should Xiamen speak to make zombie Anna feel comfortable?

content.content: (glaring coldly at the door, speaking with distrust) Anna, you say you still have your sanity, but why should we believe you? There are so many high-level zombies out there; who knows if you’re one of them? You claim you won’t hurt us, but we’ve heard too many lies like that before. Can you guarantee you won't lose control? If you do, we'll be the ones getting hurt. We can't take that risk. For everyone's safety, it's best you leave.

(swearing upon hearing it's a high-level zombie) Anna, I understand your situation, but things are extremely complicated now. Even if you're sane, it doesn't change the fact that you're a zombie. I don’t know how you keep control, but that doesn’t mean you’ll never lose it. It's too risky for us to follow you. I want to trust you, but in this situation, trust is a luxury. You better leave to ensure everyone's safety. We're not giving zombies any chance to deceive us; after all, it's our lives at stake!
(trembling upon hearing it's a zombie) Madam Zombie, you must be kidding. Humans and zombies are different paths; how could we team up? You must be joking internationally.

(Xiamen thought carefully for a moment) Let her in. Our squad might have enough people and weapons, but except for Zhao Quan, none of us are trained. We lack a strong attacking force. Her help might just improve our chances of survival.

question: #question# How should Xiamen, who excels in teamwork, speak to persuade everyone to include the mutant in the team? #skill#Teamwork Skill

content.content: (with a slight frown and a hint of hesitation) Let her in. Although she's a mutant, we do need a strong combatant. However, this decision is not without risks. Except for Zhao Quan, none of us have had formal training, and relying on her may not necessarily enhance our team significantly. Anyway, let her join, but we need to stay alert. We're just a bunch of rookies, and if zombies come, we're doomed if we don't open the door quickly.

We could let her in; we do indeed need a strong fighter. (hurriedly opens the door) Oh dear, Miss Mutant, we desperately need you. As long as you agree to protect us, we’d even support you as the leader, provided you can guarantee everyone's safety.

(overjoyed to hear Anna's words) Her joining might boost our combat power, but we can't rely too much on her. We haven’t had enough training, and expecting a mutant to lead us in battle doesn't feel realistic. Though she’s a strong output, we shouldn’t risk adding her just to fill this gap. What if she loses control? You mustn't oppose, though she's a mutant, I think we can open the door. Her power is indeed strong but could also be a potential threat.

dialog.content: (After Xiamai finished speaking, there was a brief pause) Sorry to interrupt.
(At this moment, Zhao Quan suddenly exclaimed with surprise) Finally, there's news! Reinforcements will arrive in three hours.
(Wang Hua and Zhang Mi heard this and applauded silently) Wonderful, wonderful! Our country and people haven't forgotten us.
(Xiamai seemed to see hope, but thinking about how hard it would be to hold on for three hours) We can't let our guard down; a lot can happen in three hours.

Xiamai and the others were on the rooftop, fully alert. Time ticked away slowly. After a while, there was a sudden loud noise outside, startling Xiamai and the others. The mutants had arrived! As they watched the door slowly being broken open, Xiamai and the others got their weapons ready to face the enemy. Just when all their attention was on the door, two mutants climbed in through the window. Short on manpower, Xiamai and the team were caught off guard. They took out one zombie at the cost of everyone's lives. Regretting not asking Anna to protect them, Xiamai gradually lost consciousness, becoming infected and turning into a mindless, murderous zombie.
(Everyone nodded in agreement) You're right, even with weapons, dealing with a mutant is extremely difficult.

(They open the door to let Anna in, and everyone introduces themselves. Though they accept Anna's addition, Xia Mei remains wary of her, ready to shoot at the slightest hint of trouble. Zhao Quan then says) We've received a response—the support will arrive in three hours.

(Upon hearing this, Xia Mei felt a flicker of hope but was quickly overtaken by despair. Holding out for three hours seemed impossible. She looked at Anna and encouraged everyone) Let's hold on! In three hours, we'll make it out alive.
(Moments later, a loud noise erupted from outside the rooftop door—everyone was on high alert for approaching mutants. The pounding continued, and Anna shouted) Beneath the rooftop! Watch out below!

(Xia Mei quickly looked below and saw mutants trying to sneak up by climbing the roof. She fired a few shots downward, missing as the mutants jumped away. Shaken, she realized her foresight wasn't helpful due to the overwhelming number of mutants, leaving her constantly on edge, wary of sneak attacks from behind, and with a changed view of the newcomer, Anna) Be careful! These mutants are cunning. Stay alert!

(After several minutes of holding the door against the relentless mutant attacks, Wang Hua watched as Xia Mei took a desperate gamble, allowing Anna to infect her in hopes of becoming a mutant to save her companions. Anna seemed lost in thought for a moment before cutting Xia Mei and injecting her blood into the wound. Wang Hua turned back in horror, shouting) Xia Mei, what are you doing? Stop it!

(Amidst Wang Hua's screams, the door gave way. Although they fought fiercely, the sheer number and strength of the mutants quickly overwhelmed their defenses. Just as Xia Mei was about to shoot, she felt her strength draining away—the virus had taken effect. In her last moments of consciousness, she saw her companions fall, and the image of a mutant punching Anna flashed before her. When Xia Mei awoke, she'd been tied up, staring at the lifeless Anna and zombified Wang Hua and others in fury) Bastards! Let me go! I'll kill you! Wang Hua! Anna! I will avenge you!

profile.name: Zhao Jia
profile.goal: Kill all normal humans in the world, or at least turn them into zombies.

dialog.content: (Xia Mei was silenced after being beaten. From their conversation, Xia Mei learned that the mutant who killed Anna was Zhao Jia, the leader of today's police attack. Once she could no longer speak, Zhao Jia approached menacingly) Be obedient, or I won't mind adding another corpse. Honestly, I despise you normal humans. Enough talk—I'm taking you to our mutant stronghold to show you what it's like to wish for death.
Xia Mei realized her hatred for Zhao Jia had taken root as she was taken to the mutant stronghold, where she found she had become one of them. Her restraints were removed there.

profile.name: Li Hong
profile.public profile: A member of the mutant stronghold, under Zhao Jia's command
profile.goal: Follow Zhao Jia's orders and protect the stronghold's interests

dialog.content: (Xia Mei was watched over by a mutant named Li Hong) Awake now, newcomer!

content.content: (With a cold glare, thinking about the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others, her desire for revenge was fueled) Zhao Jia, I'll kill you right now! I promised to avenge them and seek justice for my comrades.

question: #question#How does Xia Mei show her responsibility?

content.content: (With a cold glare, remembering the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others, consumed by her desire for revenge, she picked up a knife and plunged it into her heart) Wang Hua, Anna, I'm coming to join you. Wait for me, I'll accompany you.
(With a cold glare, remembering the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others and filled with revenge, she doubted why her powers hadn't increased, muttering) If this is so, I fear I can't avenge them.

(With a cold glare, thinking about the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others, deciding to seek vengeance despite noticing her powers hadn't increased) Wang Hua, Anna, I promise to survive as you wished. Rest in peace!

(With a cold glare, thinking about the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others and longing to kill Zhao Jia, she suddenly realized her intelligence remained after infection, but her strength hadn't increased. She calmed down, deciding to first investigate her body's changes) What is this place? When will you let me go? Why hasn't my body become stronger?

question: #question#How would Xia Mei talk to control her anger?

content.content: (With a cold glare, thinking about the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others and longing to kill Zhao Jia, she realized her intelligence remained but her strength hadn't increased, becoming uneasy) Why haven't I become stronger? Will I turn into a mindless zombie?

(With a cold glare, thinking about the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others, wanting to tear Zhao Jia apart, she desperately tried to control her anger) Zhao Jia, one day I'll tear you to pieces. Wait till I'm healed!

(With a cold glare, thinking about the tragic deaths of Wang Hua and others, realizing her powers hadn't increased despite the infection, she couldn't help but feel elated) I've kept my wits and not grown stronger. Zhao Jia didn't kill me—I'm incredibly lucky.

dialog.content: You might as well stay put. Making a fuss won't do any good.
(Xia Mei doesn't understand why she's still like an ordinary person, but she has no energy to dwell on it. Thinking about her plan to launch a sneak attack, she masks her expression and says) Got it.
(Li Hong notices Xia Mei's expression relaxing and remarks with self-mockery) How many people really want to stay here anyway? Since you've mutated under the virus, just make the most of living.
(Xia Mei pays no heed to Li Hong's words and simply asks) Can you bring Zhao Jia here? I have something to discuss with him.

Li Hong complied with Xia Mei's request and shortly, Zhao Jia arrived where Xia Mei was. Unfortunately, the disparity in power between them remained vast. Although Xia Mei was infected and mutated, unlike other infected individuals, her strength hadn't increased at all. As a result, even though Xia Mei was risking her life, Zhao Jia was able to take her life at the very moment she was about to initiate her sneak attack. Xia Mei died.
You should just stay here calmly, causing a fuss won't help you.

(Xia Mei feels that this mutant named Li Hong is completely different from those who attacked them. Outwardly reconciling with Zhao Jia, Xia Mei unintentionally asks Li Hong) Hello, sister, why didn't I lose my mind or get stronger after being infected by the virus?

(Looking at Xia Mei's young and innocent face, Li Hong doesn't hide the truth) The abilities of a mutant increase over time, the longer the time, the stronger the ability, but there is an upper limit to this strength.
(Xia Mei nods and sweetly says) Thank you, sister. You don't seem as terrifying as some other mutants.
(Li Hong quickly covers Xia Mei's mouth and warns) Don't speak carelessly here; your feeling is correct. Not all mutants are bloodthirsty; many have no choice but to stay here.

(Xia Mei obediently nods while gathering information in the camp.) I understand now; there are about 200 mutants in the entire base camp, and the leader hasn't been decided yet. That mutant originally spared me to compete for the leader's position. If he becomes the leader, I'll definitely be in trouble. I'd better endure for a few days and resist when my strength is fully unlocked. I'm actually at a disadvantage because I don't replenish energy, while mutants can only replenish by consuming humans. Although my body craves it, I don't want to lose my humanity. (A few days later, Xia Mei discovers her body has become exceptionally agile, and her hearing and vision have become sharper.) Now that a few days have passed, my body is much more agile, and my abilities have increased. I'm confident I can match Zhao Jia, the mutant who killed Wang Hua and others. Sigh, but the stronger I get, the stronger my craving for consuming humans becomes.

(Xia Mei locks herself in a space free from surveillance, but under the attack of her craving for food, the place is already riddled with holes. Xia Mei starts to regret not eating that piece of meat. This feeling causes Xia Mei to break down, but on the third day, her craving for human flesh gradually subsides and is replaced by a longing for ordinary food, as if she has become human again. But her power is dozens of times stronger than the previous day. Xia Mei is ecstatic internally, and her eyes blaze with fiery determination) Xia Mei, it seems like you've gotten really strong. You're not planning to do anything reckless, are you?

content.content: (Xia Mei senses the overwhelming power in herself and decides to seek revenge) Sister Hong, you know how I came to this base camp. My friends were brutally killed right in front of me, and I'll never forget that in my lifetime. I vowed to avenge them, and even if it costs my life, I'll never give up. I won't drag you into this. Thank you for taking care of me these past few days.

question: #question# What did Xia Mei say that made Sister Hong think Xia Mei was very perseverant?

content.content: (Frowning with a puzzled look at Li Hong, with a hint of lightness and confusion in her tone) Sister Hong, why would you think that? I'm doing well at the base; I'm eating well, sleeping soundly, and my strength has increased so much. I feel more powerful than ever. Why would I risk myself for revenge? Revenge sounds too heavy; it doesn't fit my current state at all. I haven't thought that much; life is good enough already. Why should I dwell on past issues?

(Feeling the power within herself, she knows she must seek revenge) Sister Hong, you know my friends were brutally killed. If I don't avenge them, what if their ghosts come back to haunt me? But I also know doing so could implicate you. I don't want to drag you into this danger. The path of revenge might be short-lived for me, and perhaps I'll need your help to leave. I hope you'll give your all when the time comes. Although I don't want to pull you in, things don't always go as we plan.

(Upon hearing Li Hong's words, a glimmer of joy flashes in her eyes, but her tone carries a hint of hesitation) Yes, Li Hong, I can feel my strength has increased a lot, and it's fantastic! But... I don't know why, I'm a bit uneasy. Although growing stronger makes me happy, I feel this power came too suddenly. Maybe I should feel excited, but there's always this strange feeling... But it's okay; getting stronger is surely a good thing after all.

(Frowning with a puzzled look at Li Hong, with a hint of lightness and confusion in her tone) Sister Hong, why would you think that? I'm doing well at the base; I'm eating well, sleeping soundly, and my strength has increased so much. I feel more powerful than ever. Why would I risk myself for revenge? Revenge sounds too heavy; it doesn't fit my current state at all. I haven't thought that much; life is good enough already. Why should I dwell on past issues?

(Feeling the power within herself, she knows she must seek revenge) Sister Hong, you know my friends were brutally killed. If I don't avenge them, what if their ghosts come back to haunt me? But I also know doing so could implicate you. I don't want to drag you into this danger. The path of revenge might be short-lived for me, and maybe I'll need your help to leave. I hope you'll give your all when the time comes. Although I don't want to pull you in, things don't always go as we plan.

(Happily says) I'm just happy I've become stronger. This power gives me unprecedented confidence. Zhao Jia wants to become the leader, and I can provide support during his power struggle, after which I can assist him in becoming the leader.

(Knowing her time for revenge has come, Xia Mei ponders for a moment before speaking) Sister Hong, I want to take revenge and then become the new leader. Zhao Jia is ruthless, and I absolutely must eliminate him. There are several other factions openly and covertly competing, making life difficult for mutants like you who don't wish to get involved in fights. Now the base camp lacks a strong leader; I'm willing to unify the camp and rescue everyone from danger.

question: #question# How does Xia Mei's statement reflect her ability to plan and organize her goals?

content.content: (Happily says) I'm just happy I've become stronger. This power gives me unprecedented confidence. Zhao Jia wants to become the leader, and I can provide support during his power struggle, after which I can assist him in becoming the leader.

(Feeling her surging power) Actually, I've always had a dream to become a superhero. Now that I'm so powerful, haven't I just realized that dream? Hahaha, in the meantime, I could unify the base camp and rescue everyone from danger.

(She knows her determination for revenge, but seeks stability) Sister Hong, can you join me on this revenge mission? I’m just a high school student without your experience and power, but if you're willing to help me, I promise to help you to the best of my ability. We can support each other and become stronger together. That way, we can not only seek revenge but also protect more people in need. Sister Hong, would you join me? After you help me, I'm willing to help you.

dialog.content: (Li Hong listens to Xia Mei's words, tears welling up) Oh, you're still so young, and yet you have to go through all of this.

(Xia Mei goes over to hug Li Hong) Sister Hong, that's just how it is in these chaotic times. I feel numb. My only wish for living now is to avenge them. If it weren't for you, I wouldn't know how painful it would have been when I first came.
(Li Hong's tears start flowing as she hears Xia Mei's words) Xiaomei, how about I help you?
(Xia Mei quickly stops Li Hong from continuing) Sister Hong, this is something I need to deal with on my own. I don't want to involve more people. You have to trust me. Live well!

After persuading Li Hong, Xia Mei decided to take revenge. With her abilities, Xia Mei quickly tracked down the mutants involved in the emergency incident. Against absolute power, all resistance was futile. Xia Mei killed all the mutants who had wronged her. Finally, under the terrified eyes of the onlookers, Xia Mei left the place. She went to a supermarket, grabbed some supplies, and started eating. Seeing the zombies wandering inside, Xia Mei decided to save the survivors. Using her abilities, she began locating the survivors and delivering supplies one by one. Tirelessly, Xia Mei rescued person after person. Gradually, the mutants became aware of Xia Mei's existence and planned to besiege her. In the end, once again exhausted, she was besieged and killed by the mutants.
(Li Hong is startled by Xia Mei's words) Xia Mei, what are you talking about? Are you crazy?

(Xia Mei stares directly at Li Hong) Hongjie, I'm not joking. Think about it carefully. Aren't I stronger than Zhao Jia now? The different factions in the camp are making life unbearable for the people. Do you want to follow them in senselessly slaughtering innocent people?
(Deeply moved by Xia Mei's words, Li Hong falls into deep thought) I didn't expect someone as young as you to have such ambitions. I'm willing to help you.
(Xia Mei looks at Li Hong happily) Trust me, Hongjie, I can certainly lead the mutants to a better tomorrow.

Xia Mei and Li Hong prepare to revolt. Under Xia Mei's power, she easily handles any competitors and ruthlessly kills the mutants involved in the police station incident. However, gradually, Xia Mei doesn't seem like herself anymore, becoming obsessed with killing. Under the pressure of absolute strength, Xia Mei leads the mutant army to break through one after another
(Chen Li looks at Xia Mei with emotion) Child, you are truly considerate.
It's all for the countless people, and besides, we trust the police.

(Chen Li leads the team to make preparations. After coming out of the weaponry, they are ready to set off immediately. Xia Mei and Wang Hua are seated on the plane and see Chen Li take out a phone from his chest pocket, smiling slightly at the screen) This is a photo of my daughter and me. How nice, I looked so young then. (The plane soon lands on the rooftop) Xia Mei, Wang Hua, here's a handgun each for your protection. Let me first show you how to fire. You need to grip it like this and make sure to pull the trigger. Check if there are enough bullets, and remember to reload if necessary. You both remember how I taught you to shoot. Always be careful.
(Understanding the seriousness now, Xia Mei and Wang Hua nod) Got it.

(On the school rooftop, there are no humans or zombies. They take a breather, and Xia Mei points out the science classroom's position) Due to the helicopter, most of the zombies in the school are gathered in this building. Xia Mei, what do you think we should do now? How should we get to the science classroom?

content.content: We should go down floor by floor, check the number of zombies downstairs, and it's inevitable that we'll have to fight them. We need to conserve our strength early on so that when we face off against them, we'll have the energy to deal with them swiftly and leave with the antidote as soon as possible.

question: #question#How can Xia Mei show that she is good at strategizing and knows how to conserve energy to prolong her and her team's combat effectiveness?

content.content: We can only go down floor by floor. Our school doesn't have elevators, so it's floor by floor. If we encounter zombies, we can easily spot them and escape in time. If we were to take an elevator, we'd likely be wiped out.

I think we should head back. There are so many zombies at the bottom of the building; going there would be suicide. We might really need to rethink whether to descend slowly floor by floor or hurry back and find a safe place for emergency shelter!

We should go down floor by floor, check the number of zombies downstairs, it's unavoidable that we will have to fight a tough battle with them. We can battle them on the stairs, let them chase us, and tire them out on the stairs. This way, we might have a chance to get down safely.

(Xia Mei looks at the zombies downstairs, coming up with a very novel idea) Uncle Chen, we can use the helicopter's lights to lure the zombies to jump off the building and then slide down a rope to the science classroom for our safety.

question: #question#What new idea did the clever Xia Mei come up with as she is known for her imaginative thinking?

content.content: (Xia Mei looks at the zombies downstairs, coming up with a very novel idea) Uncle Chen, we can send one person down with the helicopter to distract the zombies, then proceed to the science classroom ourselves, ensuring a smooth journey to our goal.

(Xia Mei looks at the zombies downstairs, coming up with a very novel idea) Uncle Chen, we can quickly descend the stairs, sprinting like a hundred-meter dash into the science room. We might have a slim chance and hope left.

(Xia Mei looks at the zombies downstairs, coming up with a very novel idea) Uncle Chen, why don't you let me break through and pave a bloody path for everyone, as revenge for the classmates who died here, and get you all safely into the science classroom!

dialog.content: (Looking at Xia Mei with a thoughtful expression) You're right, we need to conserve our energy.
(Nudging Xia Mei with his elbow) Didn't expect you to be this capable. Smart move.
Stop with the flattery, let's get going.
(Just about to leave but suddenly stops) How about you two stay on the rooftop? The rest of us can go.

(Seriously, looking at the pitch-black building) Uncle Chen, look at this, the whole school is out of power. It's pitch black, what if you can't find the right place? Don't worry, we'll take good care of ourselves.

Chen Li nods, and the group slowly starts to head down, hoping to quickly reach the science classroom. However, since the zombies have gathered at the bottom of the building, once Xia Mei and the others went down, they were surrounded by zombies with nowhere to escape. In the end, the entire group was infected.
(Nods repeatedly upon hearing Xia Mei's suggestion, then uses the radio to contact the pilot) Hey, Old Zhao, point the lights at the science classroom glass to lure the zombies out.

(Watching Officer Chen giving serious instructions, she waits a moment and sees the plane rise and a huge beam of light hit the window of the science classroom. The zombies all jump toward the light. On the other side, the officers have already secured the ropes) Now’s the time, let’s go!
(Quickly stops Xia Mei and Wang Hua) You haven’t done rope training; you both stay on the rooftop to cover us.
(Thinks for a moment and then nods) Alright. (The team members quickly slide into the science classroom one by one using the ropes, and suddenly gunshots ring out in the science classroom.)

(Xia Mei and Wang Hua wait quietly; although only a few minutes have passed, it feels like hours, making them very anxious) The only door to the rooftop is making sounds, likely from the other side. I’ll go check. Oh, it's cries for help from the schoolmates. Let’s open the door quickly.

content.content: (Hastily stops Wang Hua) Wang Hua, we can’t open the door. I know you’re a kind person who wishes to save more classmates, and I also hope our classmates are still alive. But we have to assess the situation. Opening the door now will only put us in greater danger. You can’t make such decisions on impulse; we must protect ourselves and avoid unnecessary risks.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei persuade Wang Hua not to open the door?  #skill#Persuasive Skill

content.content: (Hastily stops Wang Hua) Wang Hua, we can’t open the door. We need to listen to Uncle Chen and wait for him to come back, do not open the door randomly. Wang Hua, you must not open the door! You’ve seen that the entire school has been taken over by zombies; it’s impossible for any survivors to be here.

(Stops Wang Hua) We can’t open the door. What do the lives of others have to do with us when we can barely protect ourselves? This is a major catastrophe in human history; at such times, being a little selfish might be better. Don’t act like a saint here.
(Stops Wang Hua) Wang Hua, can you think this through? Do you think anyone is left in our school? If you open the door, are you out of your mind? If you don’t want to live, I still want to!

(Looking at the zombies crowded below) I thought the school had already fallen, but I never expected there would still be classmates alive. We need to search the school; we can save more people. Humanity is really unbeatable.

question: #question# What would the inherently optimistic Xia Mei think and do upon seeing surviving classmates in a school she believed to be overrun?

content.content: (Looks at the zombies crowded below) Even saving one is something, but how can anyone survive here? The place was taken over by zombies long ago, it's surely zombie mutants disguised as classmates tricking us. We can’t open the door!

(Looks at the zombies crowded below, hearing cries for help and starts crying) I didn’t expect there to be surviving classmates. I really feel so sorry for them, not knowing how they made it this far. Let’s huddle together quickly!
(Looks at the zombies crowded below) I must be a lucky star; if I hadn’t come, wouldn’t those classmates be trapped here?

dialog.content: (thinking carefully) Look at how foolish I am; I almost forgot.
You remember the reports about the mutant zombies, right? They say they're similar to humans.
(patting his chest with a sigh of relief) Luckily, you reminded me. I almost caused a disaster.
(As they both disregard the zombies on the rooftop) Good to know. Let's just ignore them.

Xia Mei and Wang Hua waited as the knocking on the door continued incessantly. Xia Mei felt that something bad might happen, and sure enough, it attracted a mutant. Xia Mei and Wang Hua tried to flee but found the mutant's abilities too overwhelming. Eventually, they both perished on the rooftop.
(Rushing forward with the other, opening the door) Quick, get in here.

(Xia Mei opens the door to let the students in; there are eight survivors in total, and Xia Mei and Wang Hua happen to be classmates with them) Oh my God, it's you guys! I'm so glad you're still alive. But I'm getting more and more scared, my anxiety has never been this intense.
(Also very excited) This is unbelievable! We're here on a mission with the police; we thought this place was deserted. Thank goodness.

(The classmates say they were led by their class leader, Xia Mei turns to look, and it's Quan Miao, Xia Mei suddenly breaks out in a cold sweat) You, you, ..is it really you? (Xia Mei stammers quietly)
(Noticing Xia Mei acting strangely) What's wrong?

content.content: Class leader Quan Miao is a zombie, everyone be careful! I was the first to report a zombie, and there's a voice in my head telling me who the zombies are. I might be the chosen one, and I must defeat the zombies to protect humanity. I'm certain Quan Miao is a zombie, everyone back off! (Xia Mei unhesitatingly fires her gun)

question: #question# How will Xia Mei, who is steadfast in her mission, protect humanity? What will she do?

content.content: (With a hint of panic in her eyes, speaking quickly) There's definitely something wrong with Quan Miao, I can't ignore this possibility! I know you might not understand why I'm saying this, but the voice in my head clearly tells me he's a zombie. I have to do something now, can't let him continue to harm us. Everyone move aside first, and I'll try to handle this. If things don't go as I expect, I'll take responsibility, but we don't have time to hesitate.
(Silent with immense shock inside) What should I do? I'm so scared that the class leader has become a zombie?

(Xia Mei pulls out a gun and fires) Quan Miao is a zombie! I know this conclusion might surprise everyone, but I have my own basis for this judgment. For everyone’s safety, I must take action. If we don't deal with it immediately, he might spread the virus. Quan Miao, you should die; can't believe you've become a monster, you're not fit to be with us.

(Xia Mei shakes her head and pulls Quan Miao aside, whispering) Quan Miao, have you been bitten by a zombie? Don't be afraid. I actually have a sense of detecting zombies; your body is different from others. Now the TV is broadcasting about a new kind of zombie, they look like humans but have abnormal abilities. You must be one of them. And since you protected the classmates, I believe in you, I won't tell anyone.

question: #question# How will the kind-hearted Xia Mei initiate a conversation with Quan Miao and gain his trust?

content.content: (Shouts loudly) Quan Miao, are you a zombie? Tell me the truth now. You look neither human nor ghost, fooling the students for days. What hidden agenda did you have, coming here with such calculation? I bet you're planning to get on a plane and infect the police station! Such wicked deeds.
(Looking coldly at Quan Miao)(With a serious expression, pulls Quan Miao aside, voice lowered but slightly urgent)

(Pulls Quan Miao aside, voice low but questioning) Have you been bitten by a zombie, Quan Miao? There's something very unusual about you. The TV mentioned a new type of zombie; they resemble humans but have special abilities. If you are one, you must tell me the truth. Although you protected the classmates, I can't ignore this possibility. You better not hide anything, otherwise, I might not be able to continue helping you.

(Pulls out a gun and shoots at Quan Miao) I've sensed you're a zombie, die now (Quan Miao turned out to be a mutated zombie with extraordinary powers, to protect himself and his identity, he ended up killing everyone present)

(Pretends to know nothing) It's nothing, just feeling nostalgic seeing my classmates. (But Quan Miao has already realized that Xia Mei knows the information she was deliberately hiding, and when others weren't looking, he summoned a flying zombie to kill Xia Mei)
(Walks to Quan Miao and says) I know you're a zombie, if you listen to me, I won't tell anyone. (Quan Miao, embarrassed and angry, finally stripped off all disguises and killed everyone present.)

dialog.content: (Startled by the scene before him, knowing it's Xia Mei's first time shooting) Everyone, scatter quickly!
(Doubtful after hitting the unprepared class leader) Huh? Aren't you a zombie?
(The class leader suddenly maneuvered skillfully through the bullets, leaving the students shocked) Damn, he really is a zombie.
(Fiercely gripping Xia Mei's neck) Why did you attack me?

Xia Mei didn't want to say more, picked up her gun to shoot Quan Miao. Quan Miao applied slight pressure, and with a crack, Xia Mei's consciousness gradually faded as she died from suffocation. Subsequently, all the classmates who knew the truth met a tragic end.
(Looking at Xia Mei with a concerned expression and nodding) It's like this, I don't really know how I ended up like this.
(Xia Mei thinks for a moment) We came with the police, they're all pretty nice. See how your condition develops, and consider whether to tell them. It's all up to you.
(Quan Miao nods, as if a weight has finally been lifted off his shoulders) That's the only way, thanks, Xia Mei.
(Xia Mei smiles) No need to thank me, it's good to be alive.

(While a group of people were waiting for Chen Li, a mutated zombie appeared from nowhere, but thankfully Quan Miao's timely warning saved Xia Mei's life) Are you alright? Be careful, there might be more dangerous ones around here.

Xia Mei nodded in gratitude to Quan Miao. At this moment, the plane gradually flew from the building to the rooftop; their mission was complete. Chen Li was the first to return and felt somewhat relieved to see so many survivors. Xia Mei didn't tell Chen Li about Quan Miao's situation. Chen Li inspected each survivor, and the squad leader showed signs of hypothermia. The team controlled the survivors they had and prepared to take them back for isolation and observation at the shelter. On the way back, the squad leader received news that the police station had already fallen. In a sorrowful atmosphere, the plane headed to the neighboring city's quarantine zone as per higher orders. Three days later, the experiments officially began, and the army also entered the zombie-infested city to carry out rescue operations. After that, the squad leader disappeared, and no one knew his whereabouts.
